abstract: Boeing says it expects its airplane and military businesses to earn $7.70 to $7.90 a share in 2015, down from earlier forecast of $8.20 to $8.40 a share; reports second-quarter profit of $1.71 billion, or $1.62 a share, down from $2 billion, or $2.42 a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 11 percent to $24.54 billion, from $22.05 billion year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The aircraft maker still beat analysts’ expectations by posting an 11 percent rise in revenue, to $24.5 billion.

headline.main: Boeing Lowers Profit Outlook on Tanker Charge in 2nd Quarter
headline.print_headline: Boeing Lowers Profit Outlook on a Tanker Charge

snippet: The aircraft maker still beat analysts’ expectations by posting an 11 percent rise in revenue, to $24.5 billion.
